results.title: Hunter
results.brief_description: In this 2D hand-drawn animation The Hunter, the animator uses stereotypical images (remniscent of the 50’s hollywood animation)of a tribal African wandering through the desert in search of a party. Whilst wearing shoes made from coconuts the man puts a bucket on his head and is then shot by a hunter.

results.title: The Grievance hearing
results.creator_credit: Art Babbitt, Edward L. Gershman and Academy Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Personnel Management”.
A case study of a grievance, to show how hearings are conducted, what their purposes are and how a willingness to compromise can settle most disputes. In the case shows, a worker out sick for several weeks, has forgotten to notify the company formally of her illness. Under the collective bargaining contract this constitutes an “automatic quit”. Wen the worker returns she finds that her job has been filled. On the basis of her good working record, her three years’ seniority , and the nature of her illness - an operation that prevented her from calling in - the Sop Steward files a grievance. A hearing is held, attended by the Committee Chairman and other members of the Union, the Manager, a Personnel Man, and Mary, the worker. The Company agrees to re-hire Mary, placing her where they can find room; the union agrees that this will not constitute a precedent.

results.title: Employment interview
results.creator_credit: Art Babbitt, C Moray Foutz and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Personnel Management”.
The importance of the employment interview in getting the right person on the job. A brief review of poor hiring methods is given to illustrate how good workers can be overlooked in favour of less qualified, more aggressive, workers when those who do the hiring are untrained or indifferent. The film then illustrates a good interview, step by step; obtaining information through application forms and friendly discussion, testing, use of rating scale, etc. The function of foreman and supervisors in the interview is discussed, and pre-induction preparation of the applicant hired is shown.

results.title: The Greatest story untold
results.brief_description: A short animation using both 3D claymation and 2D hand-drawn animation. A caveman wanders through the snow back to his cave and family after a hunt to find his family telling their dreams of the future. The stories differ with visions of our contemporary life, aliens kidnapping humans, and battles between good and evil.

results.title: Communications
results.creator_credit: Art Babbitt, C Fouty and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Personnel Management”.
Shows the need for effective communication in industry, not only in sales and production operations, but also in matters concerning the whole plant and its personnel. In the absence of authoritative information, rumours flourish sometimes causing serious tension among personnel, as illustrated in this film.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Art Babbitt, C Fouty and McGraw-Hill Films

results.title: The Guilt of Janet Ames
results.brief_description: Janet Ames’ whole world crashes when she learns that her husband has been killed in the war while saving the lives of five other men. Feeling that the survivors had no right to live, she sets out to visit and confront each one. What eventuates though, leaves Janet with a new perspective on life, which is something she did not bargain for.
